statement:
The *ABC conjecture* states that given any $\epsilon > 0$, there is a
constant $\kappa ( \epsilon )$ such that
$$\max(|A|,|B|,|C|) \leq \kappa ( \epsilon ) ( {\operatorname{rad}}(ABC))^{1 + \epsilon}$$
for all mutually coprime integers $A$, $B$, $C$ with $A+B=C$, where
${\operatorname{rad}}$ is the radical of an integer. This conjecture was
formulated by Masser and Oesterlé in 1980.

The ABC conjecture is considered one of the most important unsolved
problems in number , as many results would follow directly from this
conjecture. For example, Fermat’s Last Theorem could be proved (for
sufficiently large exponents) with about one page worth of proof.
